description: Users may experience unexpected application crashes due to issues affecting the Windows Routing and Remote Access Service (RRAS). This behavior arises from the underlying numeric truncation error associated with CVE-2024-30009. When this vulnerability is exploited, it can lead to remote code execution that adversely impacts system stability. Specifically, Windows products including various versions of Windows 10 and Windows 11 (build numbers such as 10.0.22631.3593 and 10.0.19045.4412) are affected. Users might notice that their systems behave erratically, potentially causing significant disruptions in their remote access capabilities. For reference, users can consult KB-5037788 and KB-5037771 for troubleshooting guidance and potential workarounds.
